alert.note: Alert for Davis; Morgan; Salt Lake; Tooele; Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 24 at 10:57AM MDT until March 24 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Salt Lake County in northern Utah... Davis County in northern Utah... Southwestern Morgan County in northern Utah... Northwestern Utah County in northern Utah... Northeastern Tooele County in northern Utah... * Until noon MDT * At 1056 AM MDT, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Hooper to near Vernon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 45 mph have been observed. SOURCE...Radar and mesonet webcam indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 273 and 337. Interstate 84 between mile markers 86 and 109. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 81 and 139. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Sandy, Layton, Murray, Bountiful, Tooele, Farmington, Grantsville, Morgan, Hill Air Force Base, West Jordan, Orem, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Lehi, Draper, Riverton, Pleasant Grove and Cottonwood Heights. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED

area.areaDesc: Davis; Morgan; Salt Lake; Tooele; Utah
